stimulusHtml: Dr. Neal is conducting research on the impact of genetics on anxiety disorders. Which of the following reflects appropriate attention to ethical procedures?
choicesHtml: Dr. Neal publishes the results of the research and although names of the subjects are included in the article, the address and phone number are not printed.

Dr. Neal meets with each of the subjects individually after the conclusion of the study to share and explain the results, answer questions, and make certain the subjects feel positive about participation in the study.

If Dr. Neal tells the subjects that he is researching genetic physical properties such as hair and eye color to not make subjects anxious about being included in an anxiety study, he would not have to debrief them.
Dr. Neal tries to minimize the paperwork and hassle for each participant by not requiring informed consent prior to the beginning of the study.
